hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a neutral regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility compressing below 40% and price breaks below the lower Bollinger Band (20,2) on a daily close, a transition to BEAR regime occurs within 5 trading days with >70% probability, offering short entry opportunities.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional breaks. Lower Bollinger Band breaks during low volatility periods signal selling pressure accumulation. MiCA regulatory uncertainty could accelerate transitions from neutral to bearish sentiment.
entry_conditions: Daily close below lower Bollinger Band (20,2)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 10% profit from entry or regime shifts to BEAR with confidence >70%
exit_conditions.time_exit: 5 trading days if no regime transition occurs

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of signals fail to trigger BEAR regime within 5 days OR false breakouts (price returns above BB within 2 days) occur in >40% of cases.
